4.1.1. src package¶

-- coding: utf-8 --

File: __init__.py

This file is necessary to compile python as a package (not a module)

From: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/448271/what-is-init-py-for The __init__.py is required to make Python treat the directories as containing packages; this is done to prevent directories with a common name, such as string, from unintentionally hiding valid modules that occur later (deeper) on the module search path. In the simplest case, __init__.py can just be an empty file, but it can also execute initialization code for the package or set the __all__ variable.

Log:
